attributes.action: have childhood strokes recognised  and dealt with earlier
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: My daughter Daisy Pritchard had a stroke after open heart surgery in June 2008 aged 21 months. Two Hospitals missed her stroke and it went undiagnosed for a week. Daisy was lucky but sadly many are not.Reports show that up to as many as 5 children die each day from undiagnosed strokes. Hospitals need to be more aware that children do have life threatening strokes and support should be made available to them and their families as sadly this has not been the case with Daisy.Daisy was initially discharged from Hospital diagnosed with shock.This must not be allowed to happen again.
